name: Hampton Inn & Suites Binghamton / Vestal

reviews.text: Hotel is conveniently located, well maintained and has excellent staff. The indoor pool and great breakfast was a hit with our children. The lobby was well appointed with a lovely adjoining patio for warm weather.
reviews.title: Convenient and Kid Friendly

reviews.text: One of the best hotel stays that I have experienced.
reviews.title: Everything was perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had to make a trip to the Vestal area for a family funeral. Little time to search for accommodation s. Without knowing the area before hand, we found this gem. It is well away from the highway noise yet easy to access.
reviews.title: Review of one Hampton Inn

reviews.text: Excellent complimentary breakfast
reviews.title: One of the best!!

reviews.text: The building was poorly designed. All common areas were at one end, requiring long walks. The breakfast area had poor acoustics, poorly designed furniture, and improperly prepared food. The bathroom toilet was too short.
reviews.title: Above and Beyond

reviews.text: Words cannot express how nice this hotel is! We were made to feel welcome from the moment we entered the door! We arrived early and they cleaned our room right away. Every member of the staff is nicer than the next! This hotel has been around for a while but looks brand new and very well maintained. The view is excellent and very relaxing after a long trip. We plan on staying here every time we are in the area!
reviews.title: Diamond!

reviews.text: We rented 3 rooms for a family stay. 2 of the rooms were fine, but the 3rd, a handicapped accessible room, had a couple of problems. It was about as far from the elevator as you could get and the handheld shower did not work. When I notified the desk clerk, he came up but couldn't get it to work either. Breakfasts were fine.
reviews.title: Be aware of handicapped problems

reviews.text: This hotel was beautiful and clean, but best of all are the beds and pillows, it was heavenly to sleep there and i love the smell of the rooms, and so far from Stamford to Vestal, there is consistency in the comfort and the cleanliness of the rooms.
reviews.title: The best beds in the World

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was clean and looked very nice; furniture was all in good condition. The AC functioned properly and wasn't overly noisy. Bathroom was clean and well stocked. The hotel corridors were reasonably quiet, even with a group of young softball players in the hotel that weekend. Reservations required us to pay in advance for our stay, which I thought was a little unusual, and the price was a bit on the high side. However, the stay was comfortable and I would choose this hotel again if we are in the area. Although the location is beside a very busy road, the property is up on the hillside, which keeps the property buffered from the road noise and traffic down below.
reviews.title: Clean and well taken care of

reviews.text: This hotel is clean and quiet. The location is surround by nature with nice breeze in mornign and evening. I enjoy a nice long stroll walk after dinner. An excellent and clean hotel to stay on either business or personal trip. The hotel decorations are very unique with handcraft items, and the laudry room makes you fell like home. I enjoy very much and defenity will return on my personal trip in later time.
reviews.title: Business trip in Hampton/Vestal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I wish there were a way to rate properties, including this one, "Good", rather than having to choose between "Average (ooo)" and "Very Good (oooo)".
reviews.title: Actually good (3 1/2), but not quite very good...

reviews.text: The short version: A good hotel, possibly a bit over-priced.* Most housekeeping seemed and the linens and bedding seemed very good. Breakfast was fairly typical of most Hampton Inns, quite adequate, including hot dishes and the breakfast buffet was kept replenished throughout the breakfast period. However there were a few factors, none really critical, which we thought placed this Hampton Inn a bit below average for Hampton Inns, which I'll detail in the longer version. Nonetheless, it would certainly be a better than "okay" place to spend a night or two.
reviews.title: Was under construction
Very clean
reviews.text: The longer version: Our room, 209, while attractively decorated, was definitely smaller than most Hampton Inn king bed rooms, or, for that matter, king bed rooms of competitive brands. This meant that there was relatively little surface (work and/or eating) space. There was no permanent furniture to hold a suitcase, and only one folding luggage stand, so the hassock for the easy chair was pressed into service, making the easy chair less easy. The unit which in most similar rooms holds the TV, microwave, mini-refrigerator and two or three full-sized drawers, was smaller and had only one (less than full-sized) drawer. The two night tables doubled as chests, each with three small drawers.

reviews.title: Perfect place to stay while visiting family
reviews.text: Likewise, the bathroom was smaller than average and so there was much less counter space than one would expect, and the vanity unit, toilet, and bathtub were particularly close together. The caulking around the bath tub showed some spots of mold. Towels supplied were a bit skimpy for a property at this level; a total of two medium-sized bath towels, two small hand towels, and two wash cloths, for two people.

reviews.title: Hotel Experience
reviews.text: While the bedroom window opens, it is not screened; the night we stayed was chilly and insects were not bothersome, on a warmer night it would likely not be reasonable to open a window.

This hotel is so comforting and comfortable. It is the best hotel because of the excellent staff. Everything is perfect here.The beds are so warm and nice, the A/C works great, even the toiletries and shampoo and soap are wonderful. Why stay anywhere else?
reviews.title: We love this hotel!

reviews.text: We were there for a wedding. In such a situation, there are lots of people with lots of requirements. The staff was great and very friendly, even when some guests tried their patience. They always had a smile. They provided great service. The room was modern, comfortable and quiet. We were very pleased.
reviews.title: Staff was great, facilities clean and comfortable

reviews.text: "Typical Hampton" is a good thing, and that's what I'm rating it against, not a Super8. The hotel was very nice. Just nothing special. The staff was friendly, the hotel was clean, the breakfast was good and the beds were comfortable. I would stay there again. If you do stay there, you will need to drive to a restaurant, or walk down hill (and then back up hill) about 1/2 a mile or so for dinner. I recall seeing an Applebee's (where we ate) and an interesting pub called the Ale House (I couldn't convince my traveling partners to go there). The hotel has a van, and advertises "courtesy service". No van driver the night we stayed there. So there ya go. If you have to go to Binghamton, and you like Hampton Inns, it will do ya fine.
reviews.title: A Nice Hotel - Typical Hampton

reviews.text: The staff is friendly and they make you feel right at home. Enjoy the outdoor patio during the summer. A special thanks to Aaron & Rebecca at the front desk. This is the hotel you want to stay at if you are in the area for business or personal.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel and Staff

reviews.text: I needed an overnight stay with two boys headed to basketball camp. The hotel was perfect. The lobby/common area was really lovely and the complimentary breakfast was one of the best I have had. The hotel and room was very clean and the staff was efficient and helpful.
reviews.title: Great Overnight Stay

aka: Hampton Inn And Suites Binghamton / Vestal
description: When you stay at the Hampton Inn & Suites hotel in Binghamton/Vestal, you're staying with friends. Our hotel is close to many major events and attractions. We have hot breakfast included, an indoor heated pool, high speed wireless internet, and a fitness facility. So, come check into the Hampton Inn & Suites hotel. Our place is yours, whether you're here for business, a show or a game at BU. You'll love our stunning city in the Empire State.
